facts.text: Civil Appeal No. 1813 of 1971 filed by special leave from judgment dated February 5, 1971 of Allahabad High Court in Special Appeal No. 1116 of 1969.

anchor.surface_text: CIVIL APPELLATE JURISDICTION Civil Appeal No. 1813 of 1971. Appeal by special leave from the judgment and decree dated February 5, 1971 of the Allahabad High Court in Special Appeal No. 1116 of 1969.

facts.text: Appellant is tenant of respondent occupying premises belonging to respondent.

anchor.surface_text: The appellant is a tenant of the respondent. She is occupying one of the premises belonging to the respondent. The respondent is seeking to evict her from the said premises.

facts.text: Respondent applied to District Magistrate Dehradun (Rent Controller) under S.3 of U.P. Temporary Control of Rent and Eviction Act, 1947 for permission to sue appellant for eviction.

anchor.surface_text: The respondent is seeking to evict her from the said premises. For that purpose she applied to the District Magistrate, Dehradun, who is also the Rent Controller, under S. 3 of the U.P.  Temporary  Control of Rent and Eviction Act, 1947  to, the hereinafter referred to as the Act  for permission to sue the appellant  for her eviction

facts.text: Rent Controller granted permission to sue for eviction.

anchor.surface_text: for permission to sue the appellant  for her eviction The permission asked for was granted by the Rent Controller.

facts.text: Appellant filed revision against permission order to Commissioner, Meerut Division, who affirmed the order.

anchor.surface_text: The permission asked for was granted by the Rent Controller. As against that order, the appellant went up in revision to the Commissioner, Meerut Division, Meerut who affirmed the order of the District Magistrate.

facts.text: Commissioner affirmed permission on March 30, 1965 in revision No. 13.

anchor.surface_text: commissioned by the Commissioner, Meerut Division, Meerut, vide his orders dated March 30, 1965, passed in revision No. 13, to file a civil suit of ejectment

facts.text: Appellant filed revision to State Government under S.7-F.

anchor.surface_text: Thereafter the appellant went up in revision to the State Government.

facts.text: State Government passed stay order on operation of permission pending consideration.

anchor.surface_text: During the pendency of that proceeding the State Government passed an order of stay which reads Operation of the permission under S. 3 of the Act granted by the Commissioner, Meerut Division, Meerut to the opposite party, landlady to file the suit for the petitioners ejectment from the house in question is stayed pending companysideration of the case by the State Government.

facts.text: State Government allowed appellant's revision and set aside permission on June 14, 1966.

anchor.surface_text: Later the State Government allowed the reyision,petition and set aside the permission granted. ... The order of the State Government dated 14-6-1966

facts.text: Respondent filed petition under Art.226 before Allahabad High Court challenging State Government order.

anchor.surface_text: The respondent challenged the legality of the order made by the State Government before the High Court of Allahabad in a petition under Art. 226 of the Constitution.

facts.text: Allahabad High Court set aside State Government order dated 14-6-1966 and directed rehearing on February 28, 1967.

anchor.surface_text: The High Court set aside the order of the Government on the ground that the State Government in, deciding the revision petition had allowed itself to be influenced by irrelevant companysiderations. ... This order was Dassed on February 28, 1967.

facts.text: Respondent filed suit for eviction of appellant on February 29, 1967.

anchor.surface_text: On the very next day, the respondent filed a suit for eviction of the appellant.

facts.text: State Government dismissed appellant's revision petition as infructuous due to institution of civil suit.

anchor.surface_text: The State Government accepted that companytention and dismissed the revision petition on the sole ground that the proceeding before it became infructuous in view of the institution of the civil suit.

facts.text: Appellant filed writ petition before Allahabad High Court challenging State Government dismissal order.

anchor.surface_text: The appellant challenged that order by means of a writ petition before the Allahabad High Court.

facts.text: Allahabad High Court dismissed appellant's writ petition on February 5, 1971 in Special Appeal No. 1116 of 1969.

anchor.surface_text: As against that order, this appeal has been brought by special leave.

facts.text: Appellant filed revision petition before State Government on April 2, 1965.

anchor.surface_text: The appellant filed the revision petition before the State Government on April 2, 1965.

facts.text: Appellant sent copy of revision petition to Minister for Irrigation on April 2, 1965.

anchor.surface_text: On the same day she sent a companyy of that petition alongwith an application to the Minister for Irrigation who had numberhing to do with the revision petition in question

facts.text: Irrigation Minister forwarded copy to Secretary Civil Supplies with note on old tenancy.

anchor.surface_text: The Irrigation Minister sent the companyy received by him to the Secretary, Civil Supplies after making the following numbere P1. look into it. So much is in my, knowledge that occupants are very very old tenant of this shop.

facts.text: Ramesh Puri wrote letter to Minister for Food and Civil Supply on May 16, 1966 recommending appellant.

anchor.surface_text: it may also be numbered that when the revision petition was pending before the State Government,some busy body by name Ramesh Puri wrote la letter to the Minister for Food and Civil Supply on May 16, 1966

facts.text: Premises is portion of premises No. 11 Rampur Mandi Road, Dehra Dun.

anchor.surface_text: regarding a portion of premises No. 11 Rampur Mandi Road, Dehra Dun.

facts.text: Supreme Court allowed appeal, set aside High Court and State Government orders, directed State Government to dispose revision within 4 months.

anchor.surface_text: In the result this appeal is allowed, the order of the High Court dismissing the writ petition as well as the order of the State Government dismissing the revision petition are set aside. Further the State Government is directed to restore the said revision and- E dispose of the same according to law.

facts.text: Suit filed by respondent was premature and does not bar State Government from disposing revision.

anchor.surface_text: In our opinion, the suit filed by the respondent was a premature one. Such a suit does number bar the State Government from disposing of the revision petition in pursuance of the order made by the High Court.
Appeal by special leave from the judgment and decree dated February 5, 1971 of the Allahabad High Court in Special Appeal No. 1116 of 1969.
The respondent challenged the legality of the order made by the State Government before the High Court of Allahabad in a petition under Art. 226 of the Constitution.

concepts.interpretation: Requires prior permission of District Magistrate to file eviction suit except on specified grounds.

interpretation_anchor.surface_text: nt for his eviction from any accommodation, except on one or. more of the following grounds  a  that the tenant is in arrears of rent for more than th

concepts.unlisted_label: Section 3, U.P. Temporary Control of Rent and Eviction Act, 1947
concepts.unlisted_description: Restriction on eviction suits without permission; lists grounds (a) to (g).

anchor.surface_text: Restriction on eviction.-- Subject to any order passed under sub- section  3  numbersuit shall. without the Permission of the District Magistrate be filed in any civil companyrt against a tenant for his eviction from any accommodation, except on one or. more of the following grounds  a  that the tenant is in arrears of rent for more than three months and has failed to pay the same to the landlord within one month of the service upon him of numberice of demand  b  that the tenant has wilfully caused or permitted to be caused substantial damage to the accommodation  c  that the tenant has, without the permission in writing of the landlord, made or permitted to be made any such companystruction as, in the opinion of the companyrt, has materially altered the accommodation or is likely substantially to dimish its value  d  that the tenant has created a nuisance or has done any act which is inconsistent with the purpose for which he was admitted to the tenancy of the accommodation, or which is likely to affect adversely and substantially the landlords interest therein
